intro: Aningeria adolfi-friederici subsp. keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan ironwood, is a member of the Fabaceae family and is native to East Africa. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree characterized by its dark, durable wood and dense foliage. The plant has bipinnate leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in dry woodland and rocky habitats. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for reforestation purposes.
